title: Artificial Intelligence decodes images perceived by the human brain
description: A Meta team has reproduced, in some cases with impressive precision, photographs viewed by volunteers based on AI analysis of their brain activity.

title: Canada withdraws 41 diplomats from India as tensions over separatist killing grow
description: Relations between India and Canada have plunged since Prime Minister Trudeau, in September, publicly linked Indian intelligence to the killing of a Canadian citizen, which New Delhi has denied.

title: Former Trump lawyer, Sidney Powell, may now testify against him
description: Powell has struck a deal with Georgia prosecutors admitting she conspired to wrongly interfere with the state's 2020 election results.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Isolated US blocks UN resolution in favor of 'direct diplomacy'
description: On October 18, Washington prevented the Security Council from adopting a text condemning 'the violence against civilians' in Gaza due to the absence of any mention of 'Israel's right of self-defense.'

title: Gaza Hospital: What detailed image analysis reveals about deadly Al Ahli Arab Hospital blast
description: Two days after the blast at the Gaza hospital, Hamas and the Israeli army continue to trade blame for the tragedy. Images authenticated and analyzed by Le Monde provide a better understanding of what happened.

title: In Jerusalem, Sunak supports Israel but demands more aid for Gaza
description: The British prime minister met with Benjamin Netanyahu and Isaac Herzog on Thursday and emphasized the need to get food, water and medicine to the 2.4 million people blocked in Gaza.

title: At least 14 French airports receive bomb threats
description: After a number of major French airports were evacuated on Wednesday, many more were the targets of bomb threats on Thursday, leading to at least eight being temporarily evacuated.

title: EU launches 'illegal content and disinformation' probes into Meta and Tiktok
description: The EU's fight against disinformation has intensified since Moscow's invasion of Ukraine last year and gained further urgency after Hamas' October 7 attack on Israel.

title: France pays tribute at funeral for teacher killed in terror attack
description: 57-year-old Dominique Bernard, a 'sensitive and discreet' husband and a 'kind' and 'passionate' teacher, was killed last week in a terror attack that shocked France.

title: Benzema, French minister clash over 'Muslim Brotherhood' claim
description: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin accused the French football star of links to the Muslim Brotherhood Islamist group.

title: EU awards Sakharov prize to Mahsa Amini
description: 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, the Iranian Kurdish woman whose death in Iranian custody a year ago triggered mass protests in Iran, and also a global movement known as 'Woman, Life, Freedom', received the Sakharov Prize for Freedom of Thought.

title: Macron tries to work out France's stance in Israel-Palestine conflict
description: The French president has said he would visit Israel in the next few days or weeks, as the part French diplomacy can play in the region appears limited.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Uncertainty remains over cause of deadly blast at Gaza hospital
description: Israel and Hamas have been trading blame for the deadly explosion. But it remains unclear what caused the blast.

title: Republican Party divisions lead to historic paralysis of US Congress
description: Trump supporter Jim Jordan failed in his second bid to become speaker of the House when he was rejected by 22 members of his own party.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Europe runs the risk of internal chaos
description: The 27 member states have opposing views on the Israel-Palestine issue, making it difficult for the EU to strike a balance between support for Israel's right to defend itself and concern for the fate of Palestinian civilians.

title: Oscar-nominated actor Burt Young dies at 83
description: The actor, best known for playing Paulie in the 'Rocky' franchise – for which he was nominated for Best Supporting Actor – died on October 8 in Los Angeles.

title: Biden warns Israel to avoid making 9/11 'mistakes,' calls for 'clarity' on war objectives
description: On a whirlwind Tel Aviv visit on Wednesday, the US president obtained a green light from Egypt and Israel for the entry of 20 trucks of humanitarian aid through the south of the Gaza Strip.

title: China to work with Egypt to help stabilize the Middle East
description: Following the 3rd Belt and Road Forum in Beijing, President Xi Jinping said China was willing to work with Cairo to 'jointly safeguard international fairness and justice as well as the common interests of developing countries.'

title: US to ease Venezuela oil, gas sanctions after election deal
description: In response to Venezuela’s government and a faction of its opposition formally agreeing to work together to reach a series of basic conditions for the next presidential election, the US agreed Wednesday to temporarily suspend some sanctions on the country's oil, gas and gold sectors.

title: 10 maps to understand Gaza's tumultuous history
description: From Egyptian occupation to Hamas control, this enclave, which has now been sealed off by Israel, is at the heart of the Middle East conflict.

title: US journalist working for Radio Free Europe detained in Russia
description: Alsu Kurmasheva, an editor with the US Congress-funded outlet's Tatar-Bashkir service, has been charged with failing to register as a foreign agent, her employer and a journalist watchdog group said Wednesday. If found guilty, she faces up to five years in jail.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Social media platforms caught up in accusations of 'partisan' moderation
description: For the past 10 days, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube and TikTok have been accused of alternately 'censoring' pro-Palestinian accounts or of inaction against Hamas.

title: US troops hurt after three drones attack American bases in Iraq
description: Two drones targeted the al Asad airbase in western Iraq used by US forces and one drone targeted a base in northern Iraq, a US official told The Associated Press on Wednesday. Iranian-backed militias have threatened to attack US facilities in Iraq because of American support for Israel.

title: Former Finnish president Martti Ahtisaari, tireless mediator for peace, has died
description: The dedicated elder statesman and diplomat, who was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2008, died on Monday, October 16, in Helsinki. He was 86 years old.

title: Paris Olympics 2024: security arrangements are taking 'all threats into account,' French government says
description: With nine months to go before the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games, the French authorities are seeking to reassure the public in the face of the increased risk of terrorism, given the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. An inter-ministerial committee meeting on security will be held on Friday.
